intro: Eugenia subavenia, commonly known as the Andean guava, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree that typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are often clustered together. Its fruit is a small, round berry that turns from green to yellow or red when mature. The leaves are elliptical, glossy, and have a slightly aromatic scent when crushed.
